intro: Cortusa pubens, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its hairy leaves and compact growth habit make it a distinctive feature in alpine environments. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
